title: Font
content:
Anyone know what type font JamisonParker used for their posters, and cd’s, and etc?  
or, if anyone could make it for me? or tell me the basics of making a font.

for refernces, see

[http://hellojackgoodbyeson.deviantart.com/art/JamisonParker-Logo-8152627...](http://web.archive.org/web/20080905083900/http:/hellojackgoodbyeson.deviantart.com/art/JamisonParker-Logo-81526275 "http://hellojackgoodbyeson.deviantart.com/art/JamisonParker-Logo-81526275")

 [‹ Mistakes in job listings - funny or scary?](http://web.archive.org/web/20080905083900/http:/www.typophile.com/node/45363 "Go to previous forum topic") [Résumé Typesetting ›](http://web.archive.org/web/20080905083900/http:/www.typophile.com/node/45948 "Go to next forum topic")
author: soundisbroken

comments.content:
Definitely custom. Most logotypes (logos made of words) are hand drawn. Note the two lowercase a’s are different styles, and the different tones (fonts are all black and white (or color and non-color). My thought is that you could reasonably duplicate the logotype by just scanning in a pencil/ink drawing.

For info on:  
the different font rendering/editing software, check out the [typowiki entry here](http://web.archive.org/web/20080905083900/http:/typophile.com/node/12015).  
the How-to section, check out the [typowikii entry here](http://web.archive.org/web/20080905083900/http:/typophile.com/node/12369).  
free typefaces that may be close to what you’re looking for, try [here](http://web.archive.org/web/20080905083900/http:/typophile.com/node/44453).

Making a typeface is no small task, it’s not really something you can just casually ask.

boy, this logo sucks. ewww.

dr

\> boy, this logo sucks. ewww.

Does it, or is it just that you don’t like it? I don’t know the band, but if they are trying to promote anarchy and disorder, then it might be an effective logo. For a bank or law office it might suck.
